etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin, from Greek aron

definitions: a North American and European plant that has arrow-shaped leaves and a broad leafy spathe enclosing a club-shaped spadix, and that bears bright red berries in late summer.

notes.text: Arum, Arisaema, and other genera, family Araceae (the arum family): several species, including jack-in-the-pulpit, cuckoopint, and skunk cabbage. The arum family also contains a number of popular houseplants, such as philodendrons and calla lilies

shortDefinitions: European plant which has arrow-shaped leaves and broad leafy spathe enclosing club-shaped spadix
